Ambiguities
```Ambiguity #1
reduce(op::O, A::StrideArraysCore.AbstractStrideArray{T}) where {O, T<:Number} in StrideArrays at /home/chriselrod/.julia/dev/StrideArrays/src/miscellaneous.jl:23
reduce(::typeof(vcat), A::AbstractVector{<:AbstractVecOrMat}) in Base at abstractarray.jl:1570

Ambiguity #2
reduce(op::O, A::StrideArraysCore.AbstractStrideArray{T}) where {O, T<:Number} in StrideArrays at /home/chriselrod/.julia/dev/StrideArrays/src/miscellaneous.jl:23
reduce(::typeof(hcat), A::AbstractVector{<:AbstractVecOrMat}) in Base at abstractarray.jl:1573```
??? (Isn't `Number` and `AbstractVecOrMat` mutually exclusive?)

text:
Technically they are not:
```julia> f(::AbstractArray{<:Number}) = 10
f (generic function with 2 methods)

julia> f(::AbstractArray{<:AbstractArray}) = 11
f (generic function with 2 methods)

julia> f(Union{}[])
ERROR: MethodError: f(::Vector{Union{}}) is ambiguous. Candidates:
  f(::AbstractArray{var"#s1", N} where {var"#s1"<:Number, N}) in Main at REPL[11]:1
  f(::AbstractArray{var"#s1", N} where {var"#s1"<:AbstractArray, N}) in Main at REPL[12]:1
Possible fix, define
  f(::AbstractArray{Union{}, N} where N)
Stacktrace:
 [1] top-level scope
   @ REPL[13]:1```
but I don't know if there are any non-pathological examples where that ambiguity can occur.
